Having paid homage to all Buddhas,
Next, we repent again.
We have briefly repented the afflictive hindrances.

As for karma,
It can adorn worldly destinies. In all places, one no longer contemplates seeking worldly liberation.
Therefore, the fruits and retributions of the six destinies are various and different, and the forms and species are distinct.
One should know that all of this is created by the power of karma.
Among the ten powers of the Buddha, the power of karma is extremely profound.
Ordinary people often give rise to doubts about this.
Why is this so?
It is because we see in the world that those who do good encounter difficulties and hardships.
Those who do evil have good fortune and success.
They say that in the world, good and evil are not distinguished.
Those who think like this all fail to deeply understand the principle of karma.
Why is this so?
It is said in the sutras:
There are three kinds of karma.
What are the three?
First, karma with present retribution;
second, karma with retribution in the next life;
third, karma with retribution in future lives.
Karma with present retribution means
doing evil in the present life and receiving retribution in this body.
Karma with retribution in the next life means
doing good or evil in this life and receiving retribution in the next life.
Karma with retribution in future lives means
either doing good or evil in countless past lives,
and receiving retribution in this life.
Or it will be experienced in the future, in countless lives.
If a person who now does evil sees good things in the present,
This is because the good karma of the retribution in the present life and the retribution in the next life from past lives has matured.
Therefore, there is this pleasant result in the present.
How is it related to creating various evil karma in the present and receiving a good retribution?
If a person who now does good encounters suffering in the present,
This is because the evil karma of the retribution in the present life and the retribution in the next life from past lives has matured.
Therefore, the power of the wholesome roots in the present is weak and cannot be dispelled.
Therefore, this painful retribution is obtained.
How is it related to creating goodness in the present and attracting an evil retribution?
How do we know this to be so?
It is currently seen in the world that those who do good
Are praised by people and respected by people.
Therefore, it is known that in the future, they will definitely attract pleasant results.
Since there was such evil karma in the past,
Therefore, the buddhas and bodhisattvas teach people to be close to good friends
And to repent together.
A good and virtuous friend is completely beneficial in attaining the Way.
Therefore, today I sincerely take refuge in the Buddha.

As for the three karmas of the body,
the first is killing.
As it is explained in the sutras,
we should consider others as we do ourselves.
Do not kill, do not use a whip.
Although humans and animals are different,

If we trace back the lives of these sentient beings,

Due to karmic causes and conditions, they have been transmigrating through the six realms,

But now they harm and eat its flesh.
This is the most severe violation of compassion.
Therefore, the Buddha said:
If you obtain leftover food, you should think of it as in a famine,

For profit, sentient beings are killed, and with wealth, all kinds of meat are obtained.
Both are evil karma.

Therefore, we sincerely seek forgiveness and repent.
